search_results.snippet: Adam Clayton Powell Jr. (November 29, 1908  April 4, 1972) was a Baptist pastor and an American politician, who represented Harlem, New York City, in the United States House of Representatives (194571). He was the first person of African-American descent to be elected from New York to Congress.
